newsitem.title: USA: AFTER THE BELL - Silicon Graphics shrs up.
newsitem.headline: AFTER THE BELL - Silicon Graphics shrs up.

text.p: Shares in Silicon Graphics jumped more than 3-1/2 points in after-hours trade Thursday on fourth quarter earnings that stormed past Wall Street estimates.
The computing systems maker posted earnings of $0.56 per share, far ahead of a First Call consensus estimate of $0.34 per share.
Traders said Silicon Graphics hit 23 in after-hours trade, above an unofficial close of 19-7/16.
Silicon Graphics also reported boosted revenues of $1.2 billion, compared with $977 million for the same period in 1996.
Sybase Inc was another gainer after the bell. The database management software company traded at 13-15/16, up from an unofficial close of 13-7/16, dealers said.
"It's active," a trader said of the trading session, adding, however, that no other companies were seeing shares stray far from U.S. market closing prices.
The New York Stock Exchange said session one had volume of 4,600 shares, compared with 1,700 for the previous day. Session two had volume of 424,961 shares, compared with 3.6 million.
